name: Aladdin Ali
title: Senior Backend / Full-Stack Engineer (.NET)
bio: I build C#/.NET backends that teams can trust in production: APIs, integrations, and the tooling that keeps behavior easy to see. I like cleaning up legacy systems, automating the boring parts with CI, and making it simple to answer “what happened?” when something goes sideways.

journey.title: Senior Backend Engineer · MahiGaming
journey.description: I build backend services in a regulated environment, where correctness and auditability decide what ships. I lean on repeatable workflows (CI and tooling) so changes are easy to review and easy to trust.

journey.title: Full Stack Engineer · Coppei
journey.description: I shipped internal tools and APIs, sped up reporting and data flows, and tightened onboarding and deployments so releases stayed routine.

journey.title: Backend Engineer · Affordable Lock & Security
journey.description: I built backend services for routing, scheduling, and quoting, then focused on speed and reliability so dispatch could move without friction.

journey.title: Haxe / Graphics Engineer · Sandbox Network
journey.description: I worked on performance-heavy engine code (rendering and diagnostics), where profiling and measurement mattered more than guessing.

highlights: I build APIs and integrations in C#/.NET that hold up under real-world constraints.
I use AI to cut busywork, but I keep guardrails and validation in place so results don’t surprise anyone.
When a UI is needed, I keep it clean and consistent (React/Next.js), especially for internal tools.
